verses.text: 治好手枯的人（太12:9~14；路6:6~11）耶穌又進了會堂，在那裡有一個人，他的一隻手枯乾了。

words.note: Short for the Gospel of Matthew
Short for the Gospel of Luke

verses.text: 眾人窺探他會不會在安息日醫治那個人，好去控告他。

words.note: The Sabbath day, a day of rest.

verses.text: 耶穌對那一隻手枯乾了的人說：「起來，站在當中！」
又對他們說：「在安息日哪一樣是可以作的呢：作好事還是壞事？救命還是害命？」他們一聲不響。

words.note: The Sabbath day, a day of rest.
Idiom meaning 'to remain silent'.

verses.text: 耶穌怒目環視他們，因他們的心剛硬而難過，就對那人說：「伸出手來！」他把手一伸，手就復原了。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for the heart/mind in the Bible.

verses.text: 法利賽人出來，立刻和希律黨人商量怎樣對付耶穌，好除掉他。

words.note: A Jewish religious and political party.
A political party supporting Herod's dynasty.

verses.text: 許多人到海邊找耶穌（太12:15~16；路6:17~19）耶穌和門徒退到海邊去，一大群從加利利來的人跟著他；

words.note: Lit. 'students at the door'.

verses.text: 還有許多人聽見他所作的一切事，就從猶太、耶路撒冷、以土邁、約旦河外和推羅、西頓一帶地方來到他跟前。

words.note: Indicates the object or agent of a verb.

verses.text: 因為人多，耶穌就吩咐門徒為他預備一隻小船，免得眾人擁擠他。

words.note: Lit. 'students at the door'.

verses.text: 他醫好了許多人，所以凡有病的都擠過來要摸他。

words.note: Turns 'sick' into 'those who are sick'.

verses.text: 污靈每次看到他，就仆倒在他面前，大聲喊叫說：「你是　神的兒子！」

words.note: A common term for evil spirits in the Bible.
Often implies reverence or submission when falling before a deity or powerful figure.
Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in English translations.

verses.text: 耶穌再三嚴厲地吩咐他們，不要把他的身分張揚出去。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, similar to 'take...and...'

verses.text: 選立十二使徒（太10:1~4；路6:12~16。參徒1:13）耶穌上了山，呼召自己所要的人，他們就來了。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'. A key term for the early followers of Jesus.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Matthew.
Verse reference for the Bible.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Luke.
Verse reference for the Bible.
Often used in Bible cross-references.
Abbreviation for the Book of Acts (使徒行傳).
Verse reference for the Bible.
Often used for a divine calling in a religious context.
Forms a noun phrase indicating the object of the following verb.
Forms a noun phrase 'those he wanted'.

verses.text: 他選立了十二個人，稱他們為使徒（有些抄本無「稱他們為使徒」一句），要他們跟自己常在一起，好差遣他們去傳道，

words.note: Indicates designation or role, 'to be' or 'as'.
Functions as an adverbial conjunction indicating purpose.
Lit. 'transmit the Way/Truth', referring to Christian doctrine.

verses.text: 又有權柄趕鬼。

words.note: A formal term for authority, often used in religious texts.

verses.text: 他選立的十二個人是：西門（耶穌給他起名叫彼得），

words.note: Specifically refers to divine appointment in a religious context.

verses.text: 西庇太的兒子雅各，和雅各的弟弟約翰（耶穌給他們二人起名叫半尼其，就是「雷子」的意思），

words.note: A transliteration of an Aramaic name for the two brothers.
A descriptive name given by Jesus.

verses.text: 安得烈、腓力、巴多羅邁、馬太、多馬、亞勒腓的兒子雅各、達太、激進派的西門，

words.note: Refers to the Zealots, a Jewish political-religious movement.

verses.text: 以及加略人猶大，就是出賣耶穌的那個人。

words.note: Refers to Judas's place of origin, Kerioth, in Judah.

verses.text: 褻瀆聖靈的罪不得赦免（太12:22~32；路11:14~23，12:10）耶穌進了屋子，群眾又聚了來，以致他們連飯都不能吃，

words.note: Primarily used in religious contexts for disrespecting sacred things.
Refers to the Holy Spirit of God.
Frequently used in religious contexts for divine forgiveness.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Matthew.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Luke.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Used in the structure '連...都/也...' to emphasize 'even...'
Used in the structure '連...都/也...' to emphasize 'even...'

verses.text: 那些和他在一起的人聽見了，就出來抓住他，因為他們說他癲狂了。

words.note: Refers to a state of mental derangement or frenzy.

verses.text: 從耶路撒冷下來的經學家說：「他有別西卜附在身上！」又說：「他靠著鬼王趕鬼。」

words.note: Refers to Jewish scholars who copied and interpreted the Scriptures.
A pagan deity or demonic figure, referred to as 'prince of demons'.
Often used in context of spirits or demons possessing someone.
A title for a chief demon, like Beelzebul.
A term for exorcism.

verses.text: 耶穌把他們叫來，用比喻對他們說：「撒但怎能趕逐撒但呢？

words.note: A common narrative form in the Bible to convey spiritual truths.

verses.text: 一國若自相紛爭，那國就站立不住；

words.note: More formal than 如果 (rúguǒ).
Often used to describe internal conflict or interaction.
Refers to internal strife or discord within a group.
A more formal or emphatic way to say 'stand'.
A verb complement indicating inability to maintain a state.

verses.text: 一家若自相紛爭，那家就站立不住。

words.note: More formal than 如果 (rúguǒ).
Often used to describe internal conflict or interaction.
Refers to internal strife or discord within a group.
A more formal or emphatic way to say 'stand'.
A verb complement indicating inability to maintain a state.

verses.text: 如果撒但自相攻打紛爭，不但站立不住，而且還要滅亡。

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew שָׂטָן
Often used as a complement after a verb, indicating inability to sustain an action.
Often used in a religious or historical context for destruction.

verses.text: 誰都不能進入壯漢的家，搶奪他的財物，除非先把壯漢捆綁起來，才可以搶劫他的家。

words.note: Indicates the object is acted upon by the verb.
Verb complement, here indicating the action of binding is completed.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，世人的一切罪和一切褻瀆的話，都可以得到赦免；

words.note: Often used in a formal or religious context for humanity.
While 'crime' is common, in a religious text, it strongly means 'sin'.
Primarily used in religious contexts.
Marks the preceding phrase as an attribute of the following noun.
Primarily used in legal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 但褻瀆聖靈的，就永世不得赦免，他還要擔當罪惡到永遠。」

words.note: Primarily used in religious contexts.
Refers to the Holy Spirit, one person of the Trinity.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, meaning 'those who blaspheme'.
Often found in religious or literary contexts.
More formal or strong than '不能' (bùnéng).
Primarily used in legal or religious contexts.
Often implies bearing a heavy burden or responsibility.
A strong term for profound wrongdoing, often with moral/religious implications.
Frequently used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 耶穌說這話，是因為他們說他有污靈附在身上。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek Ἰησοῦς
A common term in the Bible for demonic spirits.
Describes a spirit inhabiting a person or thing.

words.definition: on the body, on one's person

verses.text: 誰是耶穌的母親和弟兄（太12:46~50；路8:19~21）耶穌的母親和弟弟來了，站在外面，傳話給他，叫他出來。

words.note: Can refer to 'brothers' generally or 'brothers and sisters' in a broader sense in biblical contexts.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Matthew.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Luke.

verses.text: 有許多人正圍坐在耶穌身邊，他們告訴他：「你看，你的母親和弟弟（有些抄本在此有「妹妹」一詞）在外面找你。」

words.note: Indicates an action is in progress.
Refers to ancient hand-copied texts of scripture.
More formal or literary than 這裡 (zhèlǐ).

verses.text: 耶穌回答他們：「誰是我的母親，我的弟兄呢？」

words.note: Can refer to 'brothers' generally or 'brothers and sisters' in a broader sense in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 於是四面觀看那些圍坐的人，說：「你們看，我的母親！我的弟兄！

words.note: Can refer to 'brothers' generally or 'brothers and sisters' in a broader sense in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 凡遵行　神旨意的，就是我的弟兄姊妹和母親了。」

words.note: Often used in formal or literary contexts, especially in religious texts.
A respectful space used before names of divinity in Chinese Bibles.
Used for the 'will' or 'purpose' of God.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, meaning 'those who...' or 'that which...'.
A common biblical term referring to fellow believers.
Indicates a change of state or completion.
